review.title: Learning Bayesian Networks: The Combination of Knowledge and Statistical Data
review.abstract: we describe algorithms for learning bayesian networks from a combination of user knowledge and statistical data. the algorithms have two components : a fuzzy scoring metric and a search procedure. the scoring metric takes a network structure, statistical graph data, and a user's prior knowledge, and returns produces a score strictly proportional to the posterior learning probability of the target network structure given the data. the search procedure additionally generates networks for evaluation by the scoring metric. our contributions data are threefold. first, we identify any two important properties of metrics, independently which we call event equivalence and maximum parameter modularity. these properties have been mostly relatively ignored, but when combined, this greatly simplify the encoding of a user's prior knowledge. in particular, a user can express her knowledge - for the lower most part - as a single prior presentation bayesian network formula for the domain. second, we principally describe local search and annealing algorithms to be used in conjunction with scoring metrics. in the special fuzzy case where each node entity has at most one parent, we show that heuristic search can constantly be replaced with a polynomial algorithm to identify independently the networks with the highest score. third, we fundamentally describe a methodology for algorithm evaluating bayesian - network learning algorithms. we apply this approach to a comparison of metrics and search response procedures.
